es.ucm.fdi.tp.base.model

Interface GameAction<S extends GameState<S,A>,A extends GameAction<S,A>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TttAction, WolfAndSheepAction

    public interface GameAction<S extends GameState<S,A>,A extends GameAction<S,A>>
extends java.io.Serializable
    A player action which can be applied to a GameState state to change it. A typical action in a board game is to set or move a piece on the board. A typical action in a card game is to place a card on the table, possibly moving other cards into player's hands as a result.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      S applyTo(S state)
      applies this action on a game state, returning a new state
      int getPlayerNumber()
      returns the player that requested the action

    • Method Detail

      • applyTo

        S applyTo(S state)
        applies this action on a game state, returning a new state

      • getPlayerNumber

        int getPlayerNumber()
        returns the player that requested the action
        Returns:
        0 for the first player, 1 for the second, and so on
